3.1.1.1. cnclient.CoordinatingNodeClient¶

class cnclient.CoordinatingNodeClient(baseurl='http://cn.dataone.org/cn/', defaultHeaders={}, timeout=10, keyfile=None, certfile=None, strictHttps=True)¶
__init__(baseurl='http://cn.dataone.org/cn/', defaultHeaders={}, timeout=10, keyfile=None, certfile=None, strictHttps=True)¶

Methods

DELETE(url, url_params=None, headers=None)¶

Perform a HTTP DELETE and return the response. All values are to be UTF-8 encoded - no Unicode encoding is done by this method.

Parameters:
  • url (String) – The full URL to the target
  • url_params (dictionary of key-value pairs, or list of (key, value)) – Parameters that will be encoded in the query portion of the final URL.
  • headers (Dictionary) – Additional headers in addition to default to send
Returns:

The result of the HTTP request
GET(url, url_params=None, headers=None)¶

Perform a HTTP GET and return the response. All values are to be UTF-8 encoded - no Unicode encoding is done by this method.

Parameters:
  • url (String) – The full URL to the target
  • url_params (dictionary of key-value pairs, or list of (key, value)) – Parameters that will be encoded in the query portion of the final URL.
  • headers (Dictionary) – Additional headers in addition to default to send
Returns:

The result of the HTTP request
Return type:

httplib.HTTPResponse
HEAD(url, url_params=None, headers=None)¶

Perform a HTTP HEAD and return the response. All values are to be UTF-8 encoded - no Unicode encoding is done by this method. Note that HEAD requests return no body.

Parameters:
  • url (String) – The full URL to the target
  • url_params (dictionary of key-value pairs, or list of (key, value)) – Parameters that will be encoded in the query portion of the final URL.
  • headers (Dictionary) – Additional headers in addition to default to send
Returns:

The result of the HTTP request
Return type:

httplib.HTTPResponse
POST(url, url_params=None, headers=None, fields=None, files=None)¶

Perform a HTTP POST and return the response. All values are to be UTF-8 encoded - no Unicode encoding is done by this method. The body of the POST message is encoded using MIME multipart-mixed.

Parameters:
  • url (String) – The full URL to the target
  • url_params (dictionary of key-value pairs, or list of (key, value)) – Parameters that will be send in the message body.
  • files (list of (name, filename, value)) – List of files that will be sent with the POST request. The “name” is the name of the parameter in the MM body, “filename” is the value of the “filename” parameter in the MM body, and “value” is a file-like object open for reading that will be transmitted.
  • headers (Dictionary) – Additional headers in addition to default to send
Returns:

The result of the HTTP request
Return type:

httplib.HTTPResponse
PUT(url, url_params=None, headers=None, fields=None, files=None)¶

Perform a HTTP PUT and return the response. All values are to be UTF-8 encoded - no Unicode encoding is done by this method. The body of the POST message is encoded using MIME multipart-mixed.

Parameters:
  • url (String) – The full URL to the target
  • url_params (dictionary of key-value pairs, or list of (key, value)) – Parameters that will be send in the message body.
  • files (list of (name, filename, value)) – List of files that will be sent with the POST request. The “name” is the name of the parameter in the MM body, “filename” is the value of the “filename” parameter in the MM body, and “value” is a file-like object open for reading that will be transmitted.
  • headers (Dictionary) – Additional headers in addition to default to send
Returns:

The result of the HTTP request
Return type:

httplib.HTTPResponse
